subclassFeature.name: The Ruffian
entries: When heads need crackin' and people beatin', Ruffians are those you turn towards. These brutes may not be professional soldiers, but honor don't win you fights—violence does.

subclassFeature.name: Mean Mug
entries: Starting at 3rd level you gain proficiency in {@skill Intimidation}, or expertise in {@skill Intimidation} if you were already proficient, and you have {@quickref Advantage and Disadvantage|PHB|2|0|advantage} on melee weapon attacks against {@condition frightened} targets.

subclassFeature.name: The Right Tools
entries: You gain proficiency with martial weapons, medium armors and shields.

subclassFeature.name: Heavy Beating
entries: You can use {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|PHB|1} even when using non-finesse melee weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Menacing
entries: Starting at 9th level when facing down a ruffian, anyone might be a surprised by their intimidating presence.

An enemy hit by your {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|PHB|1} will have to make a Wisdom saving throw against your passive strength {@skill intimidation}, becoming {@condition frightened} on a fail, when {@condition frightened} in this way an enemy will have {@quickref Advantage and Disadvantage|PHB|2|0|disadvantage} on their attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Brute Force
entries: Starting at 13th level you've learned to leverage your crude strength to bully or extort anyone you see fit.

You can use your {@classFeature Cunning Action|Rogue||2} on your turn to try to {@action shove} a creature within 5 feet of you with your brutish strength. You have {@quickref Advantage and Disadvantage|PHB|2|0|advantage} on the Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check to the {@action shove}.

subclassFeature.name: Tying Up Loose Ends
entries: You become a master of finishing up dirty business and dealing with any loose ends.
When you attack a {@condition prone} creature and the attack is a hit, you automatically {@quickref Critical Hits|PHB|3|0|critically hit}.
